reviews.text:
This railway station sits on the line heading towards Wigan and Manchester in one direction and towards Southport in the other direction.

There is quite a lot of car parking spaces here, which is good to see.

There are also a couple of car parking spaces for disabled cars as well.

There are definitely no on-site personnel here.

There is a automated electronic ticketing machine on site if you want to buy a ticket for onward travel.

The security at this railway station is quite good in terms of the amount of closed-circuit television cameras that are dotted around the station.

There is a bicycle rack at this station which can probably hold about 4 bicycles at most. 

But it should also be said that further along the platform there is a collection of bike lockers as well.

The railway station here, does have digital displays of arrivals and departures on both platforms.

Both platforms do have seating areas and, all of the seating is covered so you can shelter from the bad weather if needs be.

I have given this railway station a rating of 4 out of 5 stars because basically it has a lot of facilities here for anyone wanting to use this railway station. Ok so it does not have a restroom and there are no on-site staff but that's about all I can criticize it for.
As expected for such a small and remote station.
Very close to the Leeds & Liverpool canal for walks outside of the bustle of town.
